original_text: The four bounding PCM wastes, given in Table 1, were simulated using the most appropriate materials and geometries. Mock up PCM drums were assembled using the following components: PCM drums were simulated using mild steel paint cans and lids (Fenton Packaging Ltd.); PVC bags were replicated using identical PVC sheeting (Romar Workwear Ltd.); the metallic waste was simulated using commercial grade 18/8 stainless steel, aluminium and copper (Avus Metals & Plastics Ltd.), and lead shot (Aldrich); the inorganic waste was simulated using waste Pyrex labware, crushed masonry, concrete and window glass; CeO2 (from Acros Organics, >99.9%; dried 15h at 600°C) was used as a PuO2 surrogate. Commercially available ground, granulated blast-furnace slag Calumite was used as an additive [27]. The analysed chemical composition is given in Table 3. Calumite is a powdered material, with a typical particle size distribution between limits of ca. 40 to ca. 400μm.
original_translation: Los cuatro desechos PCM límite, dados en la Tabla 1, fueron simulados utilizando los materiales y geometrías más apropiados. Los tambores PCM de prueba fueron ensamblados utilizando los siguientes componentes: los tambores PCM fueron simulados utilizando latas y tapas de pintura de acero suave (Fenton Packaging Ltd.); las bolsas de PVC fueron replicadas utilizando láminas de PVC idénticas (Romar Workwear Ltd.); los desechos metálicos fueron simulados utilizando acero inoxidable de grado comercial 18/8, aluminio y cobre (Avus Metals & Plastics Ltd.), y perdigones de plomo (Aldrich); los desechos inorgánicos fueron simulados utilizando material de laboratorio de Pyrex, mampostería triturada, concreto y vidrio de ventana; CeO2 (de Acros Organics, >99.9%; secado 15h a 600°C) fue utilizado como un sustituto de PuO2. Se utilizó Calumite, una escoria granulada de horno alto disponible comercialmente, como aditivo [27]. La composición química analizada se presenta en la Tabla 3. Calumita es un material en polvo, con una distribución típica de tamaño de partícula entre límites de aproximadamente 40 a aproximadamente 400 μm.

original_annotated_sentences: The four bounding PCM wastes, given in Table 1, were simulated using the most appropriate materials and geometries.

Mock up
PCM drums
were assembled using the following components:
PCM drums
were simulated using mild steel paint cans and lids (Fenton Packaging Ltd.); PVC bags were replicated using identical PVC sheeting (Romar Workwear Ltd.); the metallic waste was simulated using commercial grade 18/8 stainless steel, aluminium and copper (Avus Metals & Plastics Ltd.), and lead shot (Aldrich); the inorganic waste was simulated using waste Pyrex labware, crushed masonry, concrete and window glass; CeO2 (from Acros Organics, >99.9%; dried 15h at 600°C) was used as a PuO2 surrogate.
Commercially available ground, granulated blast-furnace slag Calumite was used as an additive [27].
The analysed chemical composition is given in Table 3.
Calumite is a powdered material, with a typical particle size distribution between limits of ca. 40 to ca. 400μm.
